taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Chaenactidinae;genus Chaenactis;species santolinoides;

bio:treatment.discussion: Chaenactis santolinoides is known from the southern Sierra Nevada and Transverse Ranges. It is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and may be found beyond its native range. It may be relatively recently derived from an isolated segment of C. douglasii var. alpina. The morphology of C. panamintensis (here assigned to C. douglasii var. alpina) suggests past convergence toward, or genetic influence from, C. santolinoides.
